definition: to incite disharmony/to instigate
to carry on a shoulder pole/to choose/to pick/to nitpick
to raise/to dig up/to poke/to prick/to incite/to stir up
to push aside with the hand, foot, a stick etc/to dial/to allocate/to set aside (money)/to poke (the fire)/to pluck (a string instrument)/to turn round/classifier: group, batch
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to incite a quarrel (idiom); to sow discord between people/to tell tales/to make mischief

sentences.english: He always sows dragon's teeth between them.
sentences.chinese: 他總是在他們之間挑撥離間。

sentences.english: He sowed discord among his friends.
sentences.chinese: 他在朋友中間挑撥離間。

sentences.english: Never get between husband and wife.
sentences.chinese: 千萬不要挑撥夫婦關係。

sentences.english: All they wanted was to make bad blood between them, aggravate differences and fish in troubled waters.
sentences.chinese: 他們就是要挑撥離間，擴大分歧，以便渾水摸魚。

sentences.english: I think you are instigating Dr. Dirt to form a negative feeling toward me.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲妳是在挑撥離間阿土博士和我的感情。

sentences.english: Mrs Smith enjoys setting people at loggerheads.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯太太喜歡挑撥離間。

sentences.english: On Zhizhong's instigation, Mingming has a bitter quarrel with her father.
sentences.chinese: 志忠從中挑撥，明明又與她的父親發生爭執。

sentences.english: All they wanted was to make bad blood between them and fish in troubled waters.
sentences.chinese: 他們所要做的就是挑撥離間，混水摸魚。

sentences.english: He is sowing discord among his friends.
sentences.chinese: 他在朋友中間挑撥離間。

sentences.english: These dodgy documents could allow mischief-makers to impersonate supposedly secure websites.
sentences.chinese: 挑撥離間者可用這些虛假的許可證冒充安全網站。

sentences.english: She played her two rivals off against each other and got the job herself.
sentences.chinese: 她挑撥她的兩個對手相爭，自己卻獲得了那份工作。

definition: to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to conspire
hostile/malevolence/antagonism/to view as enemy/to stand against
political position
rude and unreasonable
to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to slander/to smear/to vilify
to remain unmoved
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
personal attack
lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming)/to aggravate/to intensify
